name: HTMLOptionElement
description: The HTMLOptionElement interface represents <option> elements and inherits all classes and methods of the HTMLElement interface.

members.name: HTMLOptionElement.Option()
members.description: Is a constructor creating an HTMLOptionElement object. It has four values: the text to display, text, the value associated, value, the value of defaultSelected, and the value of selected. The last three values are optional.

parameters.name: text Optional
parameters.description: A DOMString representing the content of the element, i.e. the displayed text. If this is not specified, a default value of "" (empty string) is used.

parameters.name: value Optional
parameters.description: A DOMString representing the value of the HTMLOptionElement, i.e. the value attribute of the equivalent <option>. If this is not specified, the value of text is used as the value, e.g. for the associated <select> element's value when the form is submitted to the server.

parameters.name: defaultSelected Optional
parameters.description: A Boolean that sets the selected attribute value, i.e. so that this <option> will be the default value selected in the <select> element when the page is first loaded. If this is not specified, a default value of false is used. Note that a value of true does not set the option to selected if it is not already selected.

parameters.name: selected Optional
parameters.description: A Boolean that sets the option's selected state; the default is false (not selected). If omitted, even if the defaultSelected argument is true, the option is not selected.
